page.title: 01A FARM AREA IN S.E. SOMERSET
page.content: This area is mainly dairy farming of which Fresian cattle are the predominant milking cow with one herd of Ayrshires. It is mostly grassland which is either intensively farmed to cut twice or three times for silage or hay and grazed by cattle. Other crops such as fodder beet, maize, turnips are grown for animal feed. Cereals are also grown mostly for animal feed. Beef and sheep are also kept on a smaller scale. There is no industry in this area. Hadspen House Gardens are open to the public and are being restored to their former glory. They also have a garden centre. The area is lightly populated, most inhabitants in the three villages, Yarlington, Bratton Seymour and Shepton Montague.
